Summary: A metallic rectangular UFO passed overhead at close range and then spedoff at impossible speed, making no noise.
divs: sighting detailsfebruary 1976. i was outside making snowmen in my parents backyard,as a kid i was 11 years old. it was a bright sunny day with little cloudcover and cold. i had a great view of the landscape as many farms surrounded our place in the country. something caught my eye to the south and i looked up to see a rectangular object travelling slowly from my left to right. it was a thin object with no portholes and seemed metallic looking. i could see it clearly (it was around 11 am) and had a checker board pattern on the bottom red and silver\metallic. it appeared slightly longer than it was wide. i watched in amazment for a few seconds, i would estimate its altitude to be around 500 feet high flying level to the ground. at its closest approach it looked to be within 1000 feet of me but it did not slow down as it passed me. i had no idea what the object was as it did not resemble any of the aircraft i had observed which occasionally fly by (at higher altitudes) to halifax airport. also the airport lies west of my location and it was flying north. this object was not aerodynamic; it had square edges! i have attended many airshows (us and canadian) since and nothing resembles it! the object,which was solid as i could not see through it, continued for a few more seconds and then blindingly accelerated off continuing its trajectory that i had first seen it on. it looked like it did not climb but maintained altitude, possibly disappearing over the horizon several miles to the north. it was difficult to tell exactly where it went due to its amazing acceleration\speed, it took maybe half asecond to go several miles, (it had been travelling approx 60 mph before this) it did not make any sound. no exhaust was seen either. no sonic boom. it was then and is now a complete mystery. i never saw it again even though i still visit that spot frequently,30 years later. unfortunately i believe i was the only witness to the event, the rest of my family was in the house, and it is a lowly populated area. i remember telling my dad who was asleep on the couch but he really wasn't open\ interested in these kinds of things and besides it was already gone. soon after the event (and not before) i became keenly interested in the subject of ufo's, reading any and all books on the subject. began watching tv shows on the subject and still do to this day. its still a mystery. i believe there are unknown , intelligently controlled objects out there. the government would be 'foolish' to ignore them. i believe they do not, no matter what the press releases say! as a final note i went into engineering after high school possibly due to the feeling that was left with me. i just had to know how things 'worked'.
